@powerfulsnail Could you give more information about this, and it would be very nice if you can find the reason about this by dig viewing the client log, it located in the ~/logs/rocketmqlogs/ path.
Besides, ISSUE only used for bug report or feature quest, and please discuss your question about RocketMQ in our mailing list firstly: https://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/

@makeaaron It seems that the broker didn't create the retry topic for the consumer group.
Could you give more information about this, and it would be very nice if you can find the reason about this by dig viewing logs which located in the ~/logs/rocketmqlogs/ path.
Besides, ISSUE only used for bug report or feature quest, and please discuss your question about RocketMQ in our mailing list firstly: https://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/
So I will close this issue firstly, but if you have more question about this, please feel free to reopen this issue.

Okay,I will reconfirm in my cluster enviroment. @jackxu2011

When I send a message without passing the RPCHook value,

The desired result is that there is no operational permission.

But the server throws a nullPointerException.


It is recommended to judge whether 'request.getExtFields()' is empty in the method PlainAccessValidator#parse(), and to give a default value if it is empty.

We look at you yaml config file,you globalWhiteRemoteAddresses formate is wrong.The right globalWhiteRemoteAddresses  formate is as follows:
```
globalWhiteRemoteAddresses:
- 10.10.103.*
- 192.168.0.*

accounts:
- accessKey: RocketMQ
  secretKey: 12345678
  whiteRemoteAddress: 192.168.0.*
  admin: false
  defaultTopicPerm: DENY
  defaultGroupPerm: SUB
  topicPerms:
  - topicA=DENY
  - topicB=PUB|SUB
  - topicC=SUB
  groupPerms:
  - groupA=DENY
  - groupB=SUB
  - groupC=SUB
```
